newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Healthscope sells hospital for A$4.25 mln.
newsitem.headline: Healthscope sells hospital for A$4.25 mln.

text.p: Australian hospital group Healthscope Ltd said on Tuesday it had sold the Wangaratta private hospital in central Victoria to Hospital Corporation Australia Pty Ltd for A$4.25 million.
Healthscope said the sale, with that of the Mildura private hospital in May 1997 for S$10.7 million, was part of its ongoing A$20 million debt reduction and restructuring programme.

Healthscope deputy chairman Richard England said that following the successful sales, Healthscope was currently reviewing previously announced plans to sell the Bellbird and Bellarine hospitals in suburban Melbourne.
England said settlement on the Wangaratta hospital, a 40 bed hospital offering surgical and acute care facilities, was expected by the end of August, subject to the transfer of bed licences.
Healthscope shares ended steady at 55 cents on Tuesday.
